newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps-CFDs ease back after earlier rocket.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps-CFDs ease back after earlier rocket.

text.p: European oil swaps were all firmer by varying degrees bar easier fuel oil and unchanged naphtha.

Brent CFDs rocketed higher earlier in the day on the back of physical cargo deal and retained some, but not all of the firmer tone towards the close. May 27-30 CFDs were ranged around 7 cents over July compared with 1.5 cents under July on Thursday, although at one point talk centred around 12 cents over July.
Dated Brent jumped nearly 20 cents on the back of a cargo loading June 9-11 went for July Brent +17 cents and May 27-30 CFDs traded at Brent +10 cents over July.
The sharp tug upwards on CFDs caught some in the market by surprise and prompted speculation as to the physical buyers' two week CFD position.
"They (the physical cargo buyer) are long CFDs next week and short the week after," said one.
June 2-6 was also a touch stronger with July -12 cents heard done compared with -15 cents yesterday.

Heavy fuel lost about $1 a tonne, although at one point in the day swaps had drifted $2 off Thursday's levels. Trade was done at $82 but prices recovered with June pegged later at $82.50-83.00 and July $84.50-85.00.
Gasoline saw several June swaps concluded with $209.25, $209.50 and $209.75 all understood concluded. July was also thought done at $204.50.
Naphtha faced a quiet day on both swaps and physical markets. June was steady although both June and July did hover 50 cents higher on the back of firm crude.
"It has been very quiet, but what little gains we were showing have been lost with crude losing ground," said one trader.
